page.title: 04Woodplumpton Parish Church.
page.content: Remains of a {12th century church} can be seen in walls of vestry of this old Anglican rural church.The earliest parts of present church date to {1552.} A trefoil window is dated to {1300}.The north door has decorations of particular interest.The stone arches show signs of painting .{Church registers} begin in 1603.Regular weekly {services} include Eucharist,Mattins and Evensong.Saint's days are celebrated. Average {attendance} for the services are:Eucharist 15, Mattins 90,Evensong 35.There are 2 church wardens and 24 sidesmen.An organist leads a {choir} of 24.Average collections:150 pounds a week.Vicar is paid 4118 a year. Diocesan quota =1497 a year;5% to charity.1985 cost 5000 to rewire church. Many visit the {witch} Meg Shelton's {grave},marked by a glacial erratic Lake District
